thread.title: Fil-Am ‘The Voice US’ contestant all fired up
thread.title_full: Fil-Am ‘The Voice US’ contestant all fired up | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Rowena Tan
title: Fil-Am ‘The Voice US’ contestant all fired up
text:
by Rowena Tan
October 19, 2015 AMY LYNN VACHAL (Instagram)
Filipina singer-songwriter Amy Vachal will face her greatest challenges after advancing to the battle rounds of the 9th season of “The Voice US.”
“The challenge is this whole thing, being on the group of people from every age and every state of the country, it kinda incubated me in an environment where you are forced to answer how you are? or what do you want?” she said in an interview with ABS-CBN North America Bureau Yong Chavez.
The 26-year-old feels pressured being part of the competition but wants to stay as long as possible.
“(Being here) is like a fire that I know is sharpening me and I’m aware of it and I want to keep it,” she said.
The Brooklyn-based singer breezed through the blind auditions of the competition with a rendition of the 1930s classic “Dream A Little Dream of Me.”
Amy got the three judges – Gwen Stefani, Pharrell Williams and Blake Shelton – to turn their chairs for her and fight over her to take a spot on their team. While Adam Levine, expressed his appreciation of the singer, his team was already full and he couldn’t accommodate anyone else.
In the end, Amy chose Pharell Williams as her coach for the ninth season of the American singing competition.
The “Happy” singer has picked American singer Missy Elliott to help him mentor Amy. “Our advice is always about you know, building connection and emphasizing what to feel for them. It is always how connection and eye contact are important,” Pharell said.
Meanwhile, aside from TV viewers and online users, Amy also got the attention of “American Idol” Season 11’s champ Phillip Phillips, who sent her a tweet, saying, “How about a duet?”
For her part, Amy responded using her account, “How about we write one?”
As of this writing, Phillips hasn’t replied just yet.
